1.sop: One-Pot Toor Dal (50 g dal, 1 serving). Rinse 50 g toor dal well. Heat 1 tsp ghee in a small pot. Add: 1. ¼ tsp cumin seeds,2. pinch of hing, 3. 1–2 chopped peeled garlic cloves(optional), 4. 1 dried red chilli or ¼ tsp chilli powder, 5. ¼ tsp turmeric, Lightly sauté for 20–30 sec on low flame. Add the rinsed dal immediately and mix it with the spices. Add 1 cup water + salt to taste. Add 1 small chopped tomato and a few curry leaves(optional). Skip onions to keep it quick. Cover and cook on medium heat until soft: about 12–15 minutes (or 3–4 whistles in pressure cooker). Once cooked, just stir lightly, adjust salt and thickness (add hot water if needed). Serve hot. GARNISH: fresh coriander.

2.sop: One-Pot Toor Dal (100 g dal, 2 servings). Rinse 100 g toor dal well. Heat 2 tsp ghee in a small pot. Add: 1. ½ tsp cumin seeds, 2. pinch of hing, 3. 2–3 chopped peeled garlic cloves(optional), 4. 1 dried red chilli or ½ tsp chilli powder, 5. ½ tsp turmeric. Lightly sauté for 20–30 sec on low flame. Add the rinsed dal immediately and mix it with the spices. Add 2 cups water + salt to taste. Add 1 medium chopped tomato and a few curry leaves(optional). Skip onions to keep it quick. Cover and cook on medium heat until soft: about 12–15 minutes (or 3–4 whistles in pressure cooker). Once cooked, just stir lightly, adjust salt and thickness (add hot water if needed). Serve hot. GARNISH: fresh coriander.

3.sop: One-Pot Toor Dal (150 g dal, 3 servings). Rinse 150 g toor dal well. Heat 3 tsp ghee in a pot. Add: 1. ¾ tsp cumin seeds, 2. pinch of hing, 3. 3–4 chopped peeled garlic cloves(optional), 4. 1 dried red chilli or ¾ tsp chilli powder, 5. ¾ tsp turmeric. Lightly sauté for 20–30 sec on low flame. Add the rinsed dal and mix it with the spices. Add 3 cups water + salt to taste. Add 1 large chopped tomato and a few curry leaves(optional). Skip onions to keep it quick. Cover and cook on medium heat until soft: about 12–15 minutes (or 3–4 whistles in pressure cooker). Once cooked, stir lightly, adjust salt and thickness (add hot water if needed). Serve hot. GARNISH: fresh coriander.

4.sop: One-Pot Toor Dal (200 g dal, 4 servings). Rinse 200 g toor dal well. Heat 4 tsp ghee in a pot. Add: 1. 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2. pinch of hing, 3. 4–5 chopped peeled garlic cloves(optional), 4. 1–2 dried red chillies or 1 tsp chilli powder, 5. 1 tsp turmeric. Lightly sauté for 20–30 sec on low flame. Add the rinsed dal and mix it with the spices. Add 4 cups water + salt to taste. Add 1–2 large chopped tomatoes and a few curry leaves(optional). Skip onions to keep it quick. Cover and cook on medium heat until soft: about 12–15 minutes (or 3–4 whistles in pressure cooker). Once cooked, stir lightly, adjust salt and thickness (add hot water if needed). Serve hot. GARNISH: fresh coriander.

1.sop: HOMESTYLE ONE POT SAMBHAR WITHOUT TAMARIND: In a pressure cooker heat a little oil or ghee and do the tadka first by adding mustard sauce seeds, cumin seeds if you like, a pinch of hing, one dried red chilli, and a few curry leaves. Let them crackle. Add chopped onion and tomato and sauté for a minute, then add your vegetables like carrot, lauki, drumstick, brinjal or whatever you have. Add 50 grams washed toor dal, one to two teaspoons sambhar powder, half a teaspoon turmeric, salt, and about one and a half to two cups of water depending on how thick you like it. Close the cooker and pressure cook for four to five whistles on medium heat. Let the pressure drop naturally, then open, give it a light stir to mix the dal with the vegetables, and if you want a slight tang add a squeeze of lemon. Adjust water and salt if needed and simmer for a minute before serving.

2.sop: ONE POT SAMBHAR TWO SERVINGS: Heat oil or ghee in a pressure cooker and prepare the tadka with mustard sauce seeds, cumin seeds if you like, hing, dried red chilli, and curry leaves. Add chopped onion and tomato, sauté briefly, then add vegetables of your choice. Add 100 grams washed toor dal, two to three teaspoons sambhar powder, half to one teaspoon turmeric, salt, and about three to three and a half cups water depending on your preferred thickness. Pressure cook for four to five whistles on medium heat, let pressure release naturally, then open, stir gently, add lemon if you want slight tang, adjust water and salt, and simmer briefly.

3.sop: ONE POT SAMBHAR THREE SERVINGS: DO the tadka directly in the cooker using oil or ghee, mustard sauce seeds, cumin, hing, dried red chilli, and curry leaves. Add onion, tomato, and vegetables of your choice. Add 150 grams washed toor dal, three to four teaspoons sambhar powder, about one teaspoon turmeric, salt, and four and a half to five cups water. Pressure cook four to five whistles, let pressure settle, open and mix, add lemon for slight tang if desired, adjust seasoning and water, and simmer for a minute.

4.sop: ONE POT SAMBHAR FOUR SERVINGS: Do the tadka directly in the cooker with oil or ghee, mustard sauce seeds, cumin seeds if you prefer, hing, dried red chilli, and curry leaves. Add onion and tomato, sauté, then add vegetables. Add 200 grams washed toor dal, four to five teaspoons sambhar powder, about one to one and a quarter teaspoons turmeric, salt, and six to seven cups water. Pressure cook for four to five whistles, let pressure drop naturally, open and stir, add lemon if you want tang, adjust consistency and salt, and simmer briefly before serving.

4.sop: CHOP: Fine dice two each cucumber, tomato, onion. DRESS: Lemon + Salt + cumin powder.

1.sop: Use half a lettuce. For a simple curd-based Caesar salad for one, mix two tablespoons of thick curd with finely grated peeled garlic, lemon, a little mustard sauce, a touch of honey, and a pinch of salt, whisking until smooth. Add freshly crushed pepper powder and adjust the tanginess as you like. Dip uncut lettuce in ice water for 1 minute, remove and roughly chop. Lightly toss torn romaine or iceberg lettuce with a little olive oil for a glossy finish, then add the dressing and mix gently so the leaves don’t get soggy. Finish with grated Parmesan and extra pepper.
